page.title: 08ALL SAINTS CHURCH BARLING
page.content: Barling Church is 800_900 years old. It has a square stone tower with a wooden spire.Rev.Woolven's favourite parts of the Church are the stained glass windows.He told us that there was a gravedigger who had to open a vault to bury another body and he found a body which was in perfect condition after a 100 or so years.He ran in to tell his wife but when they got back the body had disintegrated.In the churchyard the oldest gravestone was dated 1674 it has a skull and crossbones at one end and at the other end there is a sand clock.We believe this was to remind us that everyone's life ends at sometime.There are 3 bells but they no longer swing, they are rung by ropes attached to the clappers. They are dated 1902. The church has a 15th century font and a 17th century pulpit.
